Key Match Events: Cole Anthony scored 14 out of a total of 24 points in the second half
Carter Jr. scored 19 points from the bench
Josh Hart recorded double-doubles with 15 points and 14 rebounds
Jalen Brunson and Mikal Bridges each contributed 24 points
Paolo Banchero is still missing the 33rd straight game
Carter scored three-point shots without missing against the Knicks
Knicks recorded their lowest three-point shot percentage this season, only 18.2 percent (4 out of 22)
Knicks failed to score three points in 15 consecutive attempts before Cameron Payne slotted a three-point shot at the last second
Pre-Game Insights: Orlando Magic managed to avoid a clean sweep defeat in four regular seasons against the Knicks
Orlando Magic played without mainstay players such as Franz Wagner, Jalen Siggs, and Moritz Wagner
Paolo Banchero, Magic's young star, is also still missing due to a right-handed oblique injury
Knicks played without Karl-Anthony Towns due to a knee injury
Post-Match Reflections: Carter, who previously only managed to get 8 of 50 three-point shots this season, scored three-point shots without missing against the Knicks
Knicks had taken the lead in the first quarter, but both teams exchanged advantages nine times in the second quarter
Jett Howard gave Magic a lead that was no longer overtaken by a three-point shot before buzzer, making the score 53-51
Anthony scored eight points in the third quarter as Magic outperformed Knicks 22-17
Mikal Bridges had brought the Knicks closer with a score of 83-78 through a jump shot at 7:53 in the fourth quarter
However, minton-Pope answered with a three-point shot, and Carter added two points after Bridges failed to score
The Knicks never got more than six points away, while Magic had a lead of up to 12 points towards the end of the game
Miscellaneous Highlights: Orlando Magic won with a score of 103-94
Carter previously struggled with three-point shots but performed well in this game
Knicks' lowest three-point shot percentage this season
Knicks failed to score three points in 15 consecutive attempts before Cameron Payne's last-second three-pointer
